root: ^The woman seems to be in distress. Clearly she has been waiting here for a while before you showed up.
^Hello M'am. I believe you were the person to make the 911 call?
^Hi. are you the one who called us?

g-0: ^Yes officer. I called as soon as I found him. Laying like that in a pool of blood.
^Ok M'am. Please state your name and address for the report.
^So what is your name and address Miss...
g-1: ^I am Linda. Linda Gervaise. I live ... Oh my god does it matter? I didn't kill him or anything.
^I wasn't suggesting that. Where were you at 12.00 pm last night?
^Sure thing Linda. I know you didn't. I just need to get the facts. Where were you at 12.00 pm last night?
^Oh really? It seems to me that you did.

1b: ^I was home. Sleeping. (Your calm voice has a soothing effect on her)
1c: ^What? How dare you. You show up after I've been here for an hour and accuse me of murder?
^Well the simplest answers are usually true. You were the one who called. You could have killed him and then make the call.
^Yeah, come to think about it doesn't make sense
2a: ^So where were you the night of the murder?
1d: ^So what now. Are you gonna arrest me?
^Actually yes. Put your hands behind your back.
^No I'll let the detective over there take the reins

s: ^You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in the court of law..

1f: ^I live alone. But really, shouldn't you be looking for whoever killed that man?
^We are in the middle of an investigation M'am. Please don't tell me how to do my job. What is your address?
^I'm still looking at the scene. Do not worry. We will find whoever did this. So where do you live?

g-0: ^Lincoln Ave 273. Flat number 21. Right across the street.

2f: ^And have you noticed anything unusual when you entered the scene?
^So wanna grab a beer when all this is done?

c-1: ^I do not know what is usually on a crime scene.

b: ^ I am a janitor in this building. I do maintenance. I noticed the doors were open and I looked inside.

2b: ^Did you notice someone leaving the building?
^Okay that is enough questions for now.

c-0: ^No I haven't. It was early in the morning.
c-1: ^Yes I have but not in the morning. I heard some shouting from his apartment last night before I went to bed.

c-0: ^I didn't know this was relevant. Are you saying I'm responsible for his death? My God...

s: ^It is ok you couldn't have known

c-2: ^Isn't that your job to find that out?

s: ^Come on you must have some idea.
^Listen Linda. It is important. Anything you say can help us catch whoever did this.

c-0: ^I honestly have no idea. Someone killed Chei. I do not know who.
c-2: ^Well you can look into Leo over there. He had some argument with Chei. And he really is a dangerous man.

s: ^Why do you think he is dangerous?

c-0: ^I mean look at him. He is all muscles. And that face...

2c: ^Did you notice someone leaving the building?

g-0: ^No I can't say that I have.

2d: ^Are you serious? Are you hitting on me when there is a dead man in the apartment next door?
^Yeah you are right it was unprofessional of me.
^Yeah why not? So about that drink?

c-1: ^(She stares at you. Daggers in her eyes. She is not going to have a drink with you. You creep...)

2e: ^Okay M'am thank you for your assistance. Please stay in the building until we are finished with the scene in case I have other questions.
^Okay Linda thank you for your assistance. I think you can go. You have waited enough.
